question:
(a) Highlight any four differences between urban and rural settlements. 

(b) Outline any four favourable conditions for the growth of settlements.
answer:
(a) Highlight any four differences between urban and rural settlement

(i) Buddings In urban areas are compact/ nucleated while those in rural areas are dispersed

(ii) There are many social amenities tn urban areas whereas there are few social amenities in rural areas.

(iii) Urban settlements are towns, cities, conurbations, etc. While rural settlements are isolated settlements, hamlets or villages.
(iv) People in urban settlements are generally heterogenous while people living in rural settlements are homogenous
(v) People in urban settlements engage mainly in secondary or tertiary production while people in rural settlements engage mainly in primary production.  
(vi) Population is dense in urban settlements while, it is scanty in rural settlements.
(vii) Life of people in rural settlements is quiet and simple unlike in the urban centres. (viii) Urban areas have well planned layouts while rural areas are not.
(ix) rural settlements are generally smaller n size than urban settlements.
(x) Urban settlements have distinct core/centre (CBD) whereas rural settlements have none.
(xi) Urban settlements have more developed infrastructure than rural areas.
(xii) Urban centres provide higher order service such as banking, insurance, ITC, etc than rural settlements.
(xiii) Houses in urban settlements are built with modern materials like cement blocks etc while rural areas are built with local materials like mud blocks thatch etc until recently.

(b) Outline any four favourable conditions for the growth of settlements
(i) Adequate water supply. (ii) Fertile land/ nature soil (iii) Accessibility/good transport and communication networks.
(v) Defence (vi) Presence of minerals (vii) Industrialization (viii) Commercialization/economic activities
(ix) Presence of social amenities. e.g school, hospitals etc.

question:
(a) State three advantages and two disadvantages of air transportation.

(b) Highlight five roles of road transportation in the promotion economic development.
answer:
(a) State 3 advantages and 3 disadvantages of air transportation
Advantages of air transportation
(i) Used to transport relief materials at emergency periods
(ii) Can reach the farthest, remotest and Inhospitable areas (iii) Efficient service delivery
(iv) useful In transporting perishable goods
(v) Uses direct routes (Great circle) (vi) Less affected by barriers such as land topography forest or oceans
(vii) Suitable for military operations (viii) Routes do not require construction and maintenance
(ix) Suitable for transporting items of high value (x) Convenient and comfortable
(xii) Best suited for passenger traffic.

Disadvantages of Air Transportation:

(i) Easily affected by bad weather e.g harmattan-haze, cloud and line squalls.

(ii) Accidents are usually fatal

(iii) It is very expensive to buy and maintain terms of serving spare parts etc

(iv) it depends on other means of transportation to carry goods to final consumers

(v) Not flexible, i.e cannot be used for door- to- door service (vi) Airports are expensive to construct and maintain

(vii) Expensive in terms of air fares/ charges. (viii) Space constrains for very many passengers/freight at a time.


(b) Highlights five roles of road transportation in the promotion of economic development

(i) Movement of goods and services

(ii) Movement of people

(iii) Encourages regional specialization in production

(iv) Helps in the development of large towns and cities

(v) Helps in national defense

(v) Stimulates production

(vi) Promotes national and international trade (vii) Development of tourism

(viii) Employment generation

(ix) Opening up of new lands

(x) Access to natural resources

(xi) Strengthens national integration and interaction.

question:

question:
(a) Draw an outline map of Nigeria. On the map, show and .name: (i) Abuja; (ii) three savanna vegetation belts.

(b) State four ways in which the forest vegetation of Nigeria contributes to her economy.

(c) Highlight any two problems that hinder the exploitation of forest vegetation in Nigeria.
answer:
(b) Ways in which forest vegetation contribute to Nigerian economy: 
(i) Provision of job opportunities for lumber men and forest guards.
(ii) provides wood which serves as firewood or fuel 
(iii) Provides raw materials to industries, e.g palm oil for soap-making 
(iv) provides revenue to government 
(v) Provides foreign exchange earnings 
(vi) Provision of timber for construction (vii) Provides income to lumber men and forest guards 
(viii) Provides herbs for medicinal purposes 
(ix) Some forest fruits serve as food 
(x) Raffia palms are used for making baskets, bags, brooms, etc 
(xi) Tourism and wild life 
(xii) provides leaves for thatching wrapping, etc 
(xiii) Trees are used for boat building 
(xiv) Production of palm wine 

(c) Problems that hindered the exploitation of forest vegetation In Nigeria 
(i) Inadequate motorable roads (ii) Poor terrain 
(iii) Depletion of natural vegetation (iv) inadequate capital 
(v) Presence of heterogeneous trees species (vi) Inadequate technology for tree felling 
(vii) Soil erosion/leaching (viii) High cost of survey to determine economic trees 
(ix) Some heavy logs sink during transporting than on rivers (x) Risky nature of the felling trees.

question:
(a) Highlight five problems of development of the Cross River Basin.

(b) In what five ways can these problems be solved?
answer:
Highlight five problems of development of the Cross River Basin. 
(i) Pour transportation network due to many rivers and swamps 
(ii) Soil erosion due to heavy rainfall leading to gully erosion 
(iii) Occasional flooding due to heavy rainfall 
(iv) Water and land pollution due to mining of petroleum thereby affecting agricultural practice 
(v) Death of aquatic animal resulting from pollution 
(vi) Non-exploration of potential cash crops.
(vii) Sparse population in some places
(viii) High salinity of mangrove swamp soils 

(b) In what five ways can those problems be solved? 
(i) Improvement in transport network 
(ii) Construction of bridge and fly-overs across swamp and water logged zones 
(iii) Soil erosion control measures to be improved 
(iv) Flood control measures should be adopted like building sizeable culverts
(v) Proper channelization of flood water 
(vi) Legislation on oil companies for proper disposal of effluents 
(vii) Encouragement of large scale cultivation of root crops like cassava as export / cash crops 
(viii) Encouragement of immigrants into sparsely populated areas

question:
(a) Describe lumbering in Zaire under the following headings
(I) favourable factors
(II) problems of exploitation
(III) contributions to the economy.
answer:
(I) Favourable Factors of Lumbering in Zaire 
(i) Presence of economic trees 
(ii) High demand for timber for local construction 
(iii) Presence of River Congo and roads for transportation of logs 
(iv) Government policy favours reservation of forest 
(v) Less capital intensive 
(vi) Cheap labour (vii) High demand for hard wood in foreign countries 
(viii) Demand for wood as fuel (ix) Efficient sawmill industries (x) Favourable equatorial climate 
(xi) Fertile soil. 

(II) Problems of Exploitation 
(i) Difficult to locate the mature trees in the dense forest 
(ii) Difficulty in felling big trees (iii) Transportation problem caused by difficult terrain 
(iv) Destruction of natural vegetation (v) Inadequate capital 
(vi) Gradual depletion of economic trees vii) High cost of transportation 

(III) Contribution to the Economy. 
(i) Source of revenue to the government (ii) Employment opportunities 
(iii) Raw materials for saw mill industries (iv) Planks are used for building houses/furniture 
(v) Planks ale used for railway construction and bridge 
(vi) Foreign exchange earnings (vii) Income to lumber jacks 
(viii) For building of canoes and boats (ix) Source of telephone and electric poles
